intro: Llagunoa venezuelana, commonly known as the Venezuelan lichen, is a unique species belonging to the family Lecanoraceae. It is a symbiotic organism composed of a fungus and a green alga or cyanobacterium, forming a composite organism known as a lichen. This plant thrives in humid, shaded environments, typically found on tree bark or rock surfaces in tropical and subtropical regions. Its structure consists of a thallus, which is a composite body that varies in morphology depending on the species. Llagunoa venezuelana plays an important ecological role in nutrient cycling and provides habitat for various microorganisms.
